title: Annual Literary Festival
description: Join us for our grand annual literary festival featuring renowned authors, poets, and scholars from across the country. This three-day event will include panel discussions, poetry readings, book launches, and interactive workshops on creative writing and literary criticism.
shortDescription: Three-day festival with renowned authors and interactive workshops

title: Research Methodology Workshop
description: An intensive workshop designed for postgraduate and doctoral students focusing on advanced research methodologies in English literature and linguistics. Participants will learn qualitative and quantitative research techniques, data analysis methods, and academic writing skills.
shortDescription: Workshop on advanced research methods for literature students

title: Shakespeare's Timeless Appeal
description: A scholarly lecture exploring the enduring relevance of Shakespeare's works in contemporary times. The session will analyze how themes from Shakespeare's plays resonate with modern audiences and their influence on current literature and media.

title: Creative Writing Competition
description: Annual creative writing competition open to all students. Categories include short stories, poetry, and essays. Winners will have their works published in the university literary magazine and receive cash prizes.
shortDescription: Annual writing competition across multiple categories

title: Digital Humanities Symposium
description: Explore the intersection of technology and humanities in this comprehensive symposium. Topics include digital archives, text mining, data visualization in literary studies, and the future of digital scholarship.
shortDescription: Symposium on technology's role in humanities research

title: Career Guidance Session
description: Interactive session with industry professionals and alumni discussing career opportunities for English literature graduates. Topics include publishing, media, academia, content writing, and entrepreneurship in the literary field.
shortDescription: Career guidance with industry professionals and alumni

title: International Poetry Day Celebration
description: Celebrate World Poetry Day with readings, performances, and discussions featuring student poets, faculty, and guest poets from around the region. Open mic session included for spontaneous poetry sharing.
shortDescription: Poetry readings and open mic for World Poetry Day

title: Postcolonial Literature Seminar
description: An academic seminar examining postcolonial literature from South Asia, Africa, and the Caribbean. Discussions will focus on themes of identity, resistance, and cultural hybridity in contemporary postcolonial writing.
shortDescription: Academic seminar on postcolonial literature themes
